metadata.title: CVE-2021-25312 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
HTCondor before 8.9.11 allows a user to submit a job as another user on thesystem, because of a flaw in the IDTOKENS authentication method.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-25312` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

condor - 23.4.0+dfsg-1ubuntu4
condor-annex-ec2 - 23.4.0+dfsg-1ubuntu4
condor-kbdd - 23.4.0+dfsg-1ubuntu4
condor-test - 23.4.0+dfsg-1ubuntu4
condor-upgrade-checks - 23.4.0+dfsg-1ubuntu4
condor-vm-gahp - 23.4.0+dfsg-1ubuntu4
htcondor - 23.4.0+dfsg-1ubuntu4
htcondor-annex-ec2 - 23.4.0+dfsg-1ubuntu4
htcondor-test - 23.4.0+dfsg-1ubuntu4
htcondor-upgrade-checks - 23.4.0+dfsg-1ubuntu4
minicondor - 23.4.0+dfsg-1ubuntu4
minihtcondor - 23.4.0+dfsg-1ubuntu4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: condor package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '23.4.0+dfsg-1ubuntu4').
